channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Between 26 and 25 cutsdean close, 15th September
item.description:
I hope you're doing well. We recently cut some dead branches, and I would really appreciate your help in finding a way to dispose of them properly. If possible, it would be great to arrange for a truck to pick them up and take them to a specific location. I'm not quite sure if we can just bag them up and leave them for garbage collection, so any guidance you could provide would be really helpful. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cutsdean Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorry damaged street sign, 15th September
item.description:
The street sign to Fairfield Walk (crossroads junction at Fairfield Walk/Naunton Lane/Mead Road) has been badly damaged by a reversing lorry accessing Mead Road. It is bent and broken and needs replacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Naunton Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)
